Package tr.edu.boun.osmansarioglu

Class Calculator

java.lang.Object
tr.edu.boun.osmansarioglu.Calculator
public class Calculator
extends java.lang.Object

Calculator Class

The Calculator class has the code for making calculations.

It uses Stack class having Double numbers for collecting data for calculations

It has 3 different methods to make these operations:

addValue(Object dblNo) : Adds given object "double number" on top of Stack

calculate(Object operator) : Makes mathematical calculation according to given object "mathematical operator", by popping top 2 numbers at Stack and putting the result on top of Stack

result() : Shows double number on top of Stack

Note: "Object" type is used to have flexibility at "Engine" class which sends parameters to "Calculator" class

Since:
2020-12-19
Version:
1.0
Author:
Osman Selçuk Sarıoğlu

  • Constructor Details

    • Calculator

      public Calculator()

      Constructor for Calculator

      This method is used to initialize Stake for class.

  • Method Details

    • addValue

      public void addValue​(java.lang.Object dblNo)

      addValue(Object dblNo) method for Calculator

      This method is used to add values on top of Stack stk.

      Since Stack contains Double objects, given Object dblNo is transformed to Double class first.

      Parameters:
      dblNo - Method gets dbl Object as parameter. dblNo is sent as a parameter, and it's a Double object sent from an ArrayList having different types of Objects at the same time: Double for numbers and String for operators. Therefore Object is transformed to Double while using at method.

    • calculate

      public boolean calculate​(java.lang.Object operator)

      calculate(Object operator) method for Calculator

      This method is used to make calculation by using 2 values on top of Stack stk.

      Since calculation sign is a String value, given parameter Object operator is transformed to String class while using.

      Parameters:
      operator - Method gets operator Object as parameter. operator is sent as a parameter, and it's a String object sent from an ArrayList having different types of Objects at the same time: Double for numbers and String for operators. Therefore Object is transformed to String while using at method.
      Returns:
      boolean Method returns true or false.

      true: There is enough value to make calculation, and calculation is done. false: There is not enough value to make calculation, and calculation cannot be done.

    • result

      public java.lang.String result()

      result() method for Calculator

      This method is used to send result by sending top value at Stack stk.

      Value is formated according to n,nnn,nnn.n pattern.

      "," stands for thousand separator, and "." represents decimal separator.

      Returns:
      String Method returns value as String in format mentioned above.

      public int getStkSize()
